verses.roman:
dine prabhu nānā-saṅge haya anya mana
rātri-kāle bāḍe prabhura viraha-vedana

synonyms: dine—during the daytime; prabhu—Lord Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; na-na—saṅge—by different association; haya—becomes; anya—diverted; mana—His mind; rātri-kāle—at night; bāḍe—increase; prabhura—of Lord Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; viraha-vedana—pangs of separation.
translation: Because the Lord associated with various devotees during the day, His mind was somewhat diverted, but at night the pangs of separation from Kṛṣṇa increased very rapidly.
